thread.title: Winter weather advisory issued for Columbus. See the central Ohio forecast
thread.title_full: Winter weather advisory issued for Columbus. See the central Ohio forecast

title: Winter weather advisory issued for Columbus. See the central Ohio forecast
text:
By Nathan Hart, Columbus Dispatch ,
10 hours ago Keep those snow shovels close at hand.
Franklin County and almost two dozen other Ohio counties are under a winter weather advisory from midnight Thursday to 10 a.m. Friday as one to two inches of snow is expected to fall overnight and into the morning.
Roads, and especially overpasses and bridges, will likely become "slick and hazardous" due to the snow, according to the advisory from the National Weather Service in Wilmington .
While Ohio avoided a white Christmas in 2024 , several rounds of snow are expected to hit Columbus in the coming days kicking off a wintery new year, the NWS said.
There will be a reprieve from snow on Saturday before a 50% chance of snow after 1 p.m. Sunday. The likelihood of snow will increase into Sunday night with an 80% chance of precipitation.
There is also a 50% chance of snow on Monday.
Here is the full detailed forecast so you can plan your winter activities accordingly.
Columbus weather for the week of Jan. 2, 2025 Thursday : It will be mostly cloudy with a high near 35. Wind gusts as high as 20 mph are possible. Thursday Night: There will be snow, mainly after 11 p.m. The low will be around 28. The chance of precipitation is 80% and snow accumulation of one to two inches is possible. Friday : Snow is likely, mainly before noon. It will be cloudy, with the temperature falling to around 25 by 5 p.m. Wind gusts as high as 28 mph are possible. The chance of precipitation is 60%. Less than an inch of snow accumulation is expected. Friday Night : It will be mostly cloudy with a low around 19. Saturday : It will be partly sunny with a high near 24. Wind gusts as high as 21 mph are possible. Saturday Night : It will be mostly clear with a low around 14. Sunday : Snow is likely after 1 p.m. It will be mostly cloudy with a high near 26. The chance of precipitation is 60%. Sunday Night : There will be snow. The low will be around 22 and the chance of precipitation is 100%. Monday : There is a chance of snow. It will be mostly cloudy with a high near 28. The chance of precipitation is 60%. Monday Night : It will be mostly cloudy with a low around 15. Tuesday : It will be mostly cloudy with a high near 25. Tuesday Night : It will be mostly cloudy with a low around 11. Wednesday : It will be mostly cloudy with a high near 21. This story has been updated to add new information.
NHart@dispatch.com
@NathanRHart
This article originally appeared on The Columbus Dispatch: Winter weather advisory issued for Columbus. See the central Ohio forecast
